intro: Agropyron panormitanum subsp. hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish needlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that produce wind-dispersed seeds. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves with a rough texture and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of Mediterranean and semi-arid ecosystems.
